alert.note: Alert for East Glacier Park Region; Northern High Plains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 11 at 2:45PM MST until January 12 at 11:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST SUNDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 75 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to two inches. * WHERE...Eastern Glacier National Park and adjacent foothills and plains. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 5 PM MST Sunday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 11 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.

area.areaDesc: East Glacier Park Region; Northern High Plains
